decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy Aggro - Death & Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow them down, while also applying pressure with creatures like Mirran Crusader and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck aims to control the board presence with cards like Mother of Runes and Flickerwisp, while also having utility cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Sanctum Prelate to deal with opposing threats. The deck also has a strong equipment package with cards like Batterskull, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Umezawa's Jitte for additional power and flexibility.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through powerful creatures and spells while manipulating the top of the library to gain advantage. Using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Vendilion Clique, and Counterbalance, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and control the tempo of the game. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through a combination of powerful angels and control elements.

The key strategy of this deck is to use cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Phantasmagorian to fill your graveyard with creatures, triggering effects like Bridge from Below and Prized Amalgam to create an overwhelming board presence. By utilizing cards like Narcomoeba and Ichorid, you can quickly bring back creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield and use them to fuel powerful combos like Dread Return. With the right sequencing and timing, this deck can easily overwhelm opponents with a relentless flood of creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck uses cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to tutor for the necessary pieces. To protect the combo, cards like Pithing Needle and Not of This World are included. Duress and Thoughtseize help to disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the combo to go off smoothly. The deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively by creating a massive threat that is difficult for the opponent to deal with.

The deck aims to take control of the game early on by disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Daze while efficiently deploying threats such as Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. It utilizes cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember to maintain board presence and protect its threats with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also has card advantage through cards like Brainstorm, Gitaxian Probe, and Ponder, allowing it to stay ahead in resources and apply pressure to the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, which involves using Vampire Hexmage and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck includes various ways to search for the necessary combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, and protect the combo with cards like Pithing Needle and Sejiri Steppe. The deck also includes some utility lands and removal spells to help control the game until the combo can be assembled.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive threats like True-Name Nemesis, Tarmogoyf, and Leovold, while also having disruptive elements like Thoughtseize, Abrupt Decay, and Wasteland to control the opponent's resources. It aims to apply pressure early on with mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman, while maintaining card advantage with Brainstorm, Sylvan Library, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also has access to powerful counter magic in the form of Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume. The deck focuses on using combo pieces and reanimation spells to bring out game-ending threats like Griselbrand, Jin-Gitaxias, and Elesh Norn. By leveraging the graveyard and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Force of Will and Collective Brutality helps protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing Life from the Loam to repeatedly recur key lands and disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. The abundance of graveyard interaction enables the deck to effectively manage threats while also applying pressure with cards like Punishing Fire. The diverse selection of utility lands and versatile removal spells allow for adaptability in different matchups, making it a well-rounded control deck in the Legacy format.

The deck revolves around using Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 flying indestructible Marit Lage token quickly. It includes cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to find the necessary pieces, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Pithing Needle. The deck aims to assemble the combo as quickly as possible while protecting it with cards like Not of This World, potentially winning the game in just a few turns.

This deck focuses on using various spells to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play using the Reanimate spell. By combining card draw, disruption, and reanimation effects, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Griselbrand. The inclusion of interaction spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares helps to protect the combo and deal with opposing threats. The deck's strategy revolves around fast and powerful graveyard-based plays to control the game and secure victory.

This Elves combo deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana through creatures like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle. By utilizing cards like Nettle Sentinel and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can quickly find and play key combo pieces such as Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order. Glimpse of Nature helps maintain card advantage and keep the engine running smoothly. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of elves and powerful finishers to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counter spells and removal, while also utilizing creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, along with Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional control. The inclusion of equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte provides added versatility and threats. Overall, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption, aggression, and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the tempo of the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle, while also removing threats with Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Hooting Mandrills. The deck's mana base allows for consistency in casting spells and deploying threats, with a focus on using blue and red mana sources to support the aggressive playstyle of the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing Elf creatures to generate mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid. By combining cards like Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck can search for powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth to create a game-winning board state. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. The key strategy revolves around quickly ramping up mana production, tutoring for key creatures, and overwhelming the opponent with a large army of Elves.

The deck focuses on aggressive creature plays while disrupting opponents with tax effects and removal spells. It aims to control the board by leveraging creatures with powerful abilities like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Stoneforge Mystic, and Flickerwisp. It also includes cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down opponents' strategies. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to apply pressure while disrupting opponents, ultimately leading to a board state that is difficult for opponents to recover from.
